answers.answer: Early in 2005 I went to see a gastroenterologist for stomach problems, constipation and acid reflux.  I already took the rx protronix for the acid reflux and the problem was stable till early 2005. He ordered an endoscopy and an empty stomach scan.  The endoscopy confirmed I had acid reflux so he just changed my meds to nexuim 2x per day and added zelnorm for the constipation.  The empty stomach scan came back as abnormal. There was no explanation for this abnormal result which is usually seen in patients undergoing chemotherapy or dx with diabetes.  He prescribed reglan which has helped my condition somewhat.Recently, I went to my gyn for irregular cycles that I had had for many months now.  I delivered a baby by c-section 5/04 and I had thought by this time that they would return to normal. He ordered horomone blood work and a pelvic-tv u/s. The horomone prolactin was elevated so he referred me to an endocronologist.  This doctor said it was probably due to the med reglan.  She ordered a fasting prolactin test to confirm which I did and it did come back with normal limits.  She also wanted a copy of my ultrasound and now wants to do a hysteroscopy as a result of that report.  My gyn called and said that he only wants to repeat the u/s in 6 weeks to see if my complex cyst grows to the size of a grapefruit. The results of the u/s are simple cyst on left ovary 3.3 x 2.3 x 2.7 cm, possible hydrosalpinx on the right, multiple follicles on the right ovary, complex nabothian cyst 12 x 9 x 20 mm, fluid in the endometrial canal.I am concerned.  All that I have read leads me to question of ovarian cancer, a/k/a silent killer and some people also have the same stomach complaints as I have had. I need peace of mind.  Please let me know your comment on my situation.  I am 42 with an infant and two older children.

question: I got my report today from the radiologist.  There are two cystic structures in the region of the cervix measuring up to 6.4mm in dia.  There is a midly irregular cyst in the right ovary measuring 17.7x16.4x20.8mm The right ovary measures 2.3x1.8x2.4cm with a calculated volume of 5.3 cc.  There is a complex cyst or mass in the left ovary measuring 3.2x2.9x3.1 cm which completly replaces the left ovary.  There is normal vascular flow in both ovaries.  There are no abnormal free pelvic fluid collections.  Impression:  Nabothian cyst, complex left ovarian cyst or mass, right ovarian cyst.  Should I be concerend.  My doc has put me on a low estradol pill and scheduled a tv us in 6 weeks
title: Complex cyst or mass in the left ovary
